data.title: Flavor Flav Pays U.S. Olympian’s Rent After Concerning Post
data.meta_description: Flavor Flav is taking his support for Olympians in Paris to the next level. Covering Olympian Veronica Fraley’s rent in full this month.
data.text:
Flavor Flav is taking his support for Olympians in Paris to the next level. Entertainment Weekly reported that he’s covered Olympian Veronica Fraley’s rent in full this month.

The discus thrower shared on X (formerly Twitter) that she was struggling to make the rent payment. “I compete in the Olympic Games TOMORROW and can’t even pay my rent,” she wrote. “My school only sent about 75% of my rent while they pay football players (who haven’t won anything [laughing emoji]) enough to buy new cars and houses [three thumbs down emojis].”

After seeing her post, Flavor Flav wasted no time jumping in to help. “I gotchu,,, DM me and I’ll send payment TODAY so you don’t have to worry bout it TOMORROW,” he replied. “And imma be rooting for ya tomorrow LETZ GO,!!!”

Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian also joined the effort and paid Fraley’s rent for the rest of the year. He quickly teamed up with Flavor Flav, responding, “C’mon now! I’ll split it with @flavorfav.”

Flavor Flav later shared a screenshot of what seems to be a transaction sent to Fraley at 6:18 p.m. “Man of word,” he captioned the image. “And Imma try and come by and support you in person tomorrow ,,, LMK what time.”

Ohanian also posted a screenshot of a $7,760 payment (his tech company is called Seven Seven Six, so that was a reference to his company) to Fraley with a description that simply said “MURICA.” He added, “Update! It is done.”

In another post, Fraley clarified that her frustration wasn’t with her school but with the “rules that bar me from making the amount I’m WORTH as a collegiate athlete such as NIL which favors popularity over performance.” She continued, “That’s all I’m sayin. Wish me luck tm!”

Fraley isn’t the only Team USA athlete that Flavor Flav has backed during these Olympics. Last month, the USA Water Polo announced that he had signed a five-year sponsorship deal with the Women’s and Men’s national water polo teams and would serve as their official hype man.

As part of the deal, Flavor Flav has made an undisclosed financial contribution to the 2024 USA Women’s Water Polo Olympic Team, according to the release. He’s also set to make appearances throughout the year at Water Polo events and collaborate with the teams on social media.

“Supporting USA Water Polo teams is an honor,” Flavor Flav said in the release. “As a girl dad and a champion of all sports, I’m excited to bring my energy and voice to this incredible sport. Niche sports often don’t get the spotlight they deserve, but they are packed with incredible talent and heart. Together, we’re going to make some serious waves!”

Kayla is the midday host on Detroit’s 105.1 The Bounce. She started her career in radio back in 2016 as an intern at another Detroit station and worked her way here. She's made stops in Knoxville, TN, Omaha, Ne and other places before returning to Detroit. She’s done almost everything in radio from promotions to web, creating content on social media, you name it. She’s a true Michigander, born and raised. So, you can catch her camping or vacationing up north to exploring the downtown Detroit or maybe even catching a sports game. During her free time, Kayla enjoys watching movies, roller-skating, crafting, and music festivals. She and her husband together dip into many of the great things Michigan has to offer. Together they also like to travel. A few hobbies of hers include wine and beer tastings, crafting, hiking, roller skating, movies, home improvement projects, gardening, and festivals. She’s always looking to take on more local events happening in the community. She loves connecting with the community. When writing, Kayla covers topics including lifestyle, pop culture, trending stories, hacks, and urban culture.
